item.title: Easyrsc sub help(newquestion at bottom)
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

[quote=“da real hype, post:7, topic:317461”]ya i know but i would like a special day or maybe weekend to use multiplyer.

example

keep multiplyer at 1x xp but i get the 20 and 40x bonus from gamevars then on a special day i set multiplyer to 2.0 to double the xp for that day instead of manually changing it, its what its there for is it not?[/quote]

Read up on java util calendar or java.util.Date. After understanding what they do and how to use them, you will be able to make yourself a piece code that can do what your asking.

Read full topic

item.title: Easyrsc sub help(newquestion at bottom)
item.dc:creator: @bengina bengina
item.description:
@bengina wrote:

[quote=“da real hype, post:5, topic:317461”]already did that but my easyrsc control panel multiplyer is messing up the xp rates if i leave it at 1x the rates r ok for subs(means subs gettin 40x xp) messed for regs- (means regs gettin 1x xp when they should get 20x) if i leave it at 20x its ok for regs-cuz they get 20x xp (when it should read the xp i set up which is 20x) not ok for subs-means subs is getting the 40x xp boost times the 20x multipyer =800x xp

the multiplyer only works on subs not on normal ppl i have to set the multiplyer to 20x for the reg because the multiplyer seems to not be reading the 20x regular.

the control panel does not get the regular players xp bonus i set up in gamevars it only gets the subs xp bonus i set up. any way to fix it?

by regular i mean non subscribers[/quote]

Well if you work out your maths then you would see that if you put 20x in the controll pannel and 2x in your GameVars you would get:

Regular:20x exp
Subscriber:40x exp

Or you can have subs getting 1.5x exp so they get 30x ect.ect.

Hope this helps

Read full topic

the multiplyer only works on subs not on normal ppl i have to set the multiplyer to 20x for the reg because the multiplyer seems to not be reading the 20x regular.

the control panel does not get the regular players xp bonus i set up in gamevars it only gets the subs xp bonus i set up. any way to fix it?

by regular i mean non subscribers

Read full topic

item.title: Easyrsc sub help(newquestion at bottom)
item.dc:creator: @Braa Braa
item.description:
@Braa wrote:

basically you want to set up subscriptions on your easyrsc server.
and set the xp rate for ‘the subscribed ones’ to x(times) while leaving normal players x(times)

Read full topic

item.title: Easyrsc sub help(newquestion at bottom)
item.dc:creator: @da_real_hype da real hype
item.description:
@da_real_hype wrote:

tyvm for ur help but as i have been expirementing, xents gui has xp lmultiplyer that only works for normal xp. i changed norm to 20 sub to 40 and when i goto 1 x on the mutlplyer it is 1x xp when i goto 20x its 20x(like it should be) bbut then the sub xp of 40x gets 20x boost of the multiplyer. is there a way to change the multiplayer to take into account of the xp boost ive changed in gamevars?

basically to sum it up, i want the multiplayer to stay at 1x but get the xp boosts i set up. right now 1x means 1x i want it to take it from the gamevars not the multiplyer… but still be able to use the multiplyer to multiply the gamevars xp boosts on special days

ps

i know i over think to much and i tend not to say what i mean clearly

Read full topic

item.title: Easyrsc sub help(newquestion at bottom)
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

[quote=“da real hype, post:1, topic:317461”]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,409276.0.html

i followed his guide all the way and keep getting this error compiling

[/quote]

Opps, thats was a mistake on my part.

You have two choices here:

  1. In command handler you can change the line
 	Player p = world.getPlayer(args[0]);

to

 Player p = world.getPlayer(DataConversions.usernameToHash(args[0]));
  1. You can add this into world.java

public Player getPlayer(String username) { return getPlayer(DataConversions.usernameToHash(username)); }

Which ever way you pick will work.

Read full topic
